Packages 
Package Description
com.barryholroyd.bluetoothchatdemo.activity_chat  
com.barryholroyd.bluetoothchatdemo.activity_chooser  
com.barryholroyd.bluetoothchatdemo.bluetooth
Package to encapsulate most of the Bluetooth-specific functionality.
com.barryholroyd.bluetoothchatdemo.recyclerview
RecyclerView management classes to handle both lists (discovered and paired devices).
com.barryholroyd.bluetoothchatdemo.support
Miscellaneous support classes.

Description

Bluetooth chat application.

Summary

This app demonstrates Bluetooth functionality in the form of a basic chat application. The app should be run on two separate devices. When started, it will display two lists: one for discovered devices and one for paired devices. Clicking on an entry in either list will cause the app to attempt to connect to that remote device. If the remote device is running this app, the connection will succeed and both devices will then display the chat UI and text can be sent and received. Clicking on "Done" on either device will terminate the session and both devices will return to the original screen.

Implementation

This implementation follows the Bluetooth Classic (3.0) API.

Two Activities are defined: MainActivity and ChatActivity.

  • MainActivity is the initial Activity. It is used to create a connection.
  • ChatActivity displays the chat UI and is used to run the chat session.
MainActivity displays the "client" UI, i.e., two lists of devices (discovered and paired) used to initiate a connection as a "client". It then creates a background thread to become the "server" which listens for incoming connection requests.
  • BluetoothClient is used to initiate a connection as a client.
  • BluetoothServer is used to accept a connection as a server.

In both cases, when a connection is made, ChatActivity is fired up to run the actual chat session, sending and receiving text messages.

Author:
Barry Holroyd
